summary: This is an incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing the discovery of Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, the life-saving measures attempted, his transport to a hospital, and his subsequent pronouncement of death at 7:36 a.m.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, pronounced deceased at the hospital.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The author or reporting official of the incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive and Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. Staff performed life-saving measures and transported him to Health Services and then a local hospital, where he was pronounced deceased at 7:36 a.m.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Institution medical staff noted he had 'circumficial bruising around the neck' (likely meaning 'circumferential').
Epstein was pronounced deceased at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

The timeline shows staff called for help at discovery (6:33 a.m.), escorted him to Health Services by 6:39 a.m., EMS arrived at 6:43 a.m., and he was transported to the hospital by approximately 7:10 a.m.
The document is an official incident report authored by a Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
